DOC.brief_summary: Obsessive-compulsive disorder is a disabling and frequent disorder. In some patients, the medical treatment is ineffective. The pathophysiology of this disease is still unknown. Some data suggest that basal ganglia dysfunction could participate in the occurrence of OCD. The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of subthalamic nucleus high-frequency stimulation in patients with severe OCD.
DOC.brief_title: Subthalamic Nucleus (STN) Stimulation and Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
DOC.criteria: Severe obsessivecompulsive disorder Contraindication to magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) Severe cognitive or behavioral disorders
